title: Print, "Design for Wall Niche with a Stove", 1745
medium: Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper
inscribed:
On plate, upper center: C.P.S.C.M.; upper right: T; below, in the image (2 lines): Dessein d'un Poële de terre vernissée en blanc…différemment.; lower right: 2

Letters A and B identify differently decorated trumeaux on each side of the niche.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 80 and 81)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Design for Wall Niche with a Stove", 1745.
1745. Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-285-107.
